Mark    COSBY

EDUCATION 
September 2010 –  July 2014 Ulster University  
BEng Mechanical Engineering with first class honours  
 TECHNICAL SKILLS  
Experience  includes  use of the following software packages: 
• ACCAT - Adhesion  Management  Tool  
•    Cad Systems including –  Solidworks, Solid Edge , Autocad  
• Microsoft Office  
 
WORK EXPERIENCE  
August  2019 – Present   TFL Engineering, Palestra  
Senior Rail Vehicles Engineer         
Delivery of adhesion management through the leaf fall season, including 
the set up and continued development of the logic behind London 
Undergrounds “ACCAT” adhesion management tool. I nvestigation and 
attribution of incidents potentially related to low adhesion. Identification 
and implementation of improvements to the adhesion management system.  
Lead engineer for overhaul for London Undergrounds Rail Adhesion Trains, 
including development of the brakes overhaul process and completion of 
the appropriate assurance processes for return to service.   
 
June 2017 –  August 2019  TFL Engineering, Palestra  
Position Band 3 Rail Vehicles Engineer  
Undertaking planned repair and upgrades to various rolling stock systems,  
this has involved investigating component failure and implementing 
solutions, seeking efficiencies in maintenance intervals on critical 
components, developing tender documentation, creating/reviewing engineering drawings, undertaking analytical investigation to inform 
decision making and writing w ork instructions , all these tasks have had to 
be performed while ensuring correct assurance processes are met.  
I have through this position developed advanced knowledge of various 
subsystems, including but not limited to, gearboxes , traction motors , 
wheels ets and train car bodies.  Involvement with human factors in the 
upgrade to ergonomic and safety performance of Train Operator seats.  
 
March 2016 – June 2017  London Underground, Westferry Circus  
Mechanical Engineer -  Rolling Stock  
Primarily offering technical support to the Project Team of the Central Line Rolling Stock periodic maintenance programme (HOPL). Providing plus 
seeking technical solutions and support for both expected  and unforeseen 
project issues. Including, supplier de sign/quality issues, unexpected 
repairs , ensuring safety standards are met and service standards are 
minimally impacted.  
This has been achieved through building relationships  with stakeholders 
and suppliers , plus organising resource within TFL engineering.  
 
July 2014 –  Feb 2016   John Crane, Slough 
Design Engineer  
Product design to specific customer requirements, performance of 
analytical investigation to ensure desired function, investigation and detail design for manufacture, stress analysis . 
Proposed and helped to develop a new graduate training structure with the 
company.  
 
May 2012 - May 2013  Dromone Engineering, Co Meath, Ireland  
Placement Product Engineer  
Detailed analysis plus modelling of problems, product and jig design with involvement in the design review process, new product testing and 
prototyping, communication with OEM customers, production of product and process documentation.  
 
Feb 2007 -  April 2 012  Echo Northern Ireland LTD, Belfast  
Customer Advisor  
Customer service function.  
 
INTERESTS AND ACHIEVEMENTS  
Academic  
IMechE Frederic Barnes Waldron "Best Student" Award 2014,  
 
Publications  
Co-author of academic paper ‘Structural and Frictional Performance of 
Fused Deposition Modelled Acrylonitrile Butadiene Styrene (P430) with a view to use as Rapid Tooling Material in Sheet Metal Forming’ featured in 
Key Engineering Materials Vol. 639 (2015) pp 325 -332.  
 
References  
Mr Steve Whysall     Dr Alan Leacock

career_advancement: Focus on building core technical skills
Seek mentorship from senior team members
Take on challenging projects to gain experience
